title: British Airways launches Valencia service
text:
British Airways launches Valencia service 28 July 2015 Save 
British Airways is to start flying to the Spanish city of Valencia this November from Gatwick. 
The direct route from the West Sussex airport will operate four times a week and will increase to six times a week next summer. 
Lynne Embleton, British Airways’ managing director at Gatwick said: “Valencia is one of Spain’s cultural gems offering a huge range of sights and activities for holiday-makers throughout the year. 
“Our new flights to Valencia mean even more choice for British Airways customers and marks the latest in a long line of popular new routes we’ve launched this year from Gatwick. 
Flights start from £85 return for a hand baggage only fare including all taxes and charges, with complimentary drinks and snacks during the flight.
